intro: Eriostemon angustifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters. It is often found in open forests and woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
